subject: NEW YORK TIMES Confirms Satanic Pact

comments.upictitle: A Work In Progress: Sherlock reading
comments.article: Whatever you need to help you remain a Jets fan, man.

George, I know how you feel.  I am a Vikings fan.  Four trips to SuperBowl, never a win.  Plus I have to watch the idiotic Terry Bradshaw every week to remind me.  Peterson is awesome, but what can I expect this year?  Probably not much...
comments.subject: I know the feeling

comments.article: You're right. It's really the only reasonable explanation: I mean, even Denver fired Shanahan. What else but a pact with the Dark Powers could have motivated that? It only remains to see if the Jets and/or Giants will be receiving trades for marquee players in all of the other league-leading teams in exchange for "a draft option to be named later"...
comments.subject: Re: I know the feeling

comments.upictitle: Xray Is As Xray Does: howler monkey
comments.article: Now that the Times (with their finger on the pulse of last year's trends!) has published an article on it, we can declare the curse officially OVER. Congratulations, George. Now it will only take a couple of years before the rest of the country catches up. I predict a great year for the Jets...in 2011. ;-)
Maybe they should change their team colors to match Satan's? Or maybe it's the name "Jets" that is bad luck? Don't they play in New Jersey? Maybe that's the problem.... :-)

They were in a pact with the 1967 Toronto Maple Leafs, who won their thirteenth Stanley Cup that year against the heavily favoured Montreal Canadiens, and have not won another since!

Doug.
fun article. It has been a while since the Jets have done nothing but torture their fans...

As a Saints fan, I find your attempts to define yourself as a fan of a "cursed franchise" offensive.

1) we went 20 years without a winning season
2) we went over 30 years without a playoff win
3) the best season in our history was '06, when we were killed in the NFC championship game
4) No matter what happens, you will always be able to say "well, at least we had 1969"

I will listen to sports whining from the following franchises:

Arizona Cardinals, Chicago Cubs....that is all.

Plus you still have the Giants.
comments.subject: Seriously, this maudlin Jets stuff has to go

Maybe you will be less offended, albeit still stupid.

comments.article: I'm a Steelers fan.  I find it interesting that the Jets wanted to talk to Bill Cowher, who quickly said he wasn't interested.  If Cowher had been coaching for the Jets management and not the Steelers, he would have been fired long before he had his Superbowl teams.  Most good coaches will have bad years, and Cowher had several worse than the Jets' this year.  But the Pittsburgh management sticks with their coaches, unlike most of the NFL owners where it is win quick or else.  Another key to the Steelers' success over the years is that they don't go for the pricey free agent talent, unlike the Jets.  Remember Neil O'Donnell?  How many millions did the Jets pay to get him away from Pittsburgh?  How many seasons did he last after that?  When will they learn to develop young talent rather than go for the high priced free agents past their prime?
comments.subject: Jets coach firing

comments.article: I wonder what the difference is in how much the Steelers invest in scouting and player development compared to teams like the Jets, Lions, Chiefs, etc. We saw that this season the Jets were absolutely clueless on how to develop their top draft pick Vernon Gholston. While I can understand why they needed the marquee name of Brett Favre in order to sell tickets and merchandise, they showed an over-estimation in the quality of their offensive line or the coaching.
comments.subject: Re: Jets coach firing

comments.article: No, but AOL did. So which is worse?

Saints, Redskins, Vikings, Jets......

You make me laugh. For a true exercise in Sisyphean futility, be like me, live in Detroit, and be a Lions fan.

1 playoff win since 1957.

0-16 this year.

Enough said.

comments.subject: If the Jets were really cursed

comments.article: There's always next season.
comments.subject: Re: If the Jets were really cursed

comments.article: the article was entertaining, but I don't see how Super Bowl III is still "the greatest upset in pro football history"--yes technically the 19-point-favored Colts were more heavily favored than the 12-point-favored Pats....but the Pats were 18-0 having just finished a season in which they broke pretty much every offensive record in the game

From what I've read Baltimore was crushing teams not only offensively but defensively as well.  While the Jets had a great offense they had just squeaked past the Raiders to get to the Superbowl. Most folks also had the belief that the AFL was a sub-par league. Comparatively the Pats had their flaws exposed in the second half of the season. The Giants just a month earlier played them to a field goal's difference. Given the old rule that defense wins championships I would argue that 12 points were too much for the Pats to be favored by.

comments.upictitle: Jeanne / Xaviara al'Nady / Tita Kini: BecauseIsaidSo
comments.article: ROFLMAO!!!!

comments.upictitle: [not pictured]: meta Safiiru moodless collected nerdy
comments.article: A certain something in this article reminded me of you.
Did anyone catch whether Favre and Pennington shook hands at any point last week? Because Chad is doing a nice job of looking like him at the moment with those INTs.:P

I believe that Favre left without shaking hands with anyone. I could be wrong.

Well Chad is who we thought he is. A weak armed pocket passer. It wasn't so much that he played poorly, but more so the Ravens made him play poorly. And, neither he nor the Dolphins had the tools to overcome that type of pressure. He's a smart guy who I think could be very good in coaching. I expect he'll probably have a backup position next season and likely not with the Dolphins.

This whole weekend has been odd, considering all things football. How did the Chargers beat the Colts? Also, Atlanta fans should really be ashamed. I guess Kurt Warner had some magic left in his arm. Forget Favre, Warner has been the over-the-hill renaissance man this season. Maybe the Jets will look into getting him next season? He'd throw fewer INT's and come far cheaper. I guess the Utah Utes were for real after all, after dispatching Alabama. If UF beats OU, I think Utah should jump to #1 (or at least a share). Wasn't it Alabama that beat Florida early in the season? Of course the BCS (Bull Complete Shit)rankings and major conference/East Coast bias will probably deny the Utes the title no matter what.

The Utes appear to have been for real, I agree. But even though Bama was #1 for a while, they definitely weren't the best team when they held the rank... so I wouldn't be behind wishing them to jump over OK and TX to be #1 if FL wins. To me, it really seems like TX should be #1 right now because their only loss was a screwy ending to a game, sort of a fluke. To get jumped by OK and FL was bad enough, to get jumped by the Utes would be a sin.
LMAO

I know you want these comments for comments that are relevant to the story, but I've noticed that on your site it has been over a year since the Ice and Fire update has been updated. Could you possibly give us another update to let us know how the book is coming along.
Yes, It would be nice to have an update.

Your teams's owner is not Satan...er Jerry Jones.

Or there is the Raiders. Al Davis is more like DEATH. I've wondered if he remains alive by draining the lifeforce of the Raider franchise.

comments.article: As much as Al Davis has become a caricature, I still get the impression that the Raiders could in his remaining lifetime field a championship calibre team.

Any tips from you guys? George?
